fr.zelus.jarvis.plugins.generic_chat.module

Class GenericChatModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zelus.jarvis.core.JarvisModule
      • fr.zelus.jarvis.plugins.generic_chat.module.GenericChatModule

  • public class GenericChatModule
extends JarvisModule
    A generic JarvisModule class that wraps concrete chatting sub-modules.

    This class is used to define generic orchestration models that can be bound to specific chatting platforms through the provided Configuration. ActionInstances created by this module wraps concrete ActionInstances defined in the concrete sub-modules.

    This module provides the following generic JarvisActions:

    • PostMessage: post a message to the channels specified in the provided Configuration
    Note: this module only provides a concrete implementation of GenericChatAction, that is used to represent all the JarvisActions specified in the GenericChatModule. GenericChatAction construction is handled by the createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession) method that overrides the default behavior of JarvisModule.
    See Also:
    GenericChatAction

    • Field Detail

      • CONCRETE_CHAT_MODULES_KEY

        public static final String CONCRETE_CHAT_MODULES_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the concrete chat sub-module to use.
        See Also:
        loadSubModule(String), Constant Field Values

      • CONCRETE_CHAT_PROPERTY_PREFIX_KEY

        public static final String CONCRETE_CHAT_PROPERTY_PREFIX_KEY
        The Configuration key prefix used to bound specific values to generic action parameters.

        As an example, this prefix is used to specify, for each sub-module, the platform specific channel associated to the generic channel parameter.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericChatModule

        public GenericChatModule(JarvisCore jarvisCore,
                         Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a new GenericChatModule from the provided jarvisCore and Configuration.

        This constructor initializes the underlying sub-module list with the concrete JarvisModule paths retrieved from the CONCRETE_CHAT_MODULES_KEY Configuration property. Note that the property can contain a single path or a list.

        Note: this constructor will throw a JarvisException if at least one of the concrete sub-modules cannot be built. The provided Configuration should contain all the sub-module specific properties (e.g. access tokens).

        Parameters:
        jarvisCore - the JarvisCore instance associated to this module
        configuration - the Configuration used to initialize the underlying sub-module list
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided jarvisCore or Configuration is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided Configuration does not contain a CONCRETE_CHAT_MODULES_KEY property.
        See Also:
        CONCRETE_CHAT_MODULES_KEY, loadSubModule(String)

      • createJarvisAction

        public JarvisAction createJarvisAction(ActionInstance actionInstance,
                                       JarvisSession session)
        Creates a GenericChatAction wrapping the concrete sub-module JarvisActions corresponding to the provided ActionInstance.

        This method iterates the sub-module list and calls their JarvisModule.createJarvisAction(ActionInstance, JarvisSession) method with the provided actionInstance and session. The returned JarvisActions are then wrapped into a GenericChatAction that takes care of executing them through the regular JarvisCore#handleEvent(EventInstance, JarvisSession) process.

        Overrides:
        createJarvisAction in class JarvisModule
        Parameters:
        actionInstance - the ActionInstance representing the JarvisAction to create
        session - the JarvisSession associated to the action
        Returns:
        the GenericChatAction wrapping the concrete sub-module JarvisActions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided actionInstance or session is null
        JarvisException - if the provided ActionInstance does not match any JarvisAction for a sub-module, or if an error occurred when building the JarvisAction
        See Also:
        GenericChatAction
